poem:
Title: "Stargazers' Song"

Maggie, born of London fog,
Shared a dream adorned in stars,
Her heart of red, the crimson cog,
Where kin of light no shadow mars.

An underestimated child,
In physics' net, her spirit twined.
With Sky at Night, she reconciled,
A universe in each mind.

Reach, she said, beyond the finite,
For stardom waits not in afar,
It gleams within each quiet night,
In every child, a pulsing star.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
